title: Public Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF (Khartoum)
Interview Descriptions: Easy fast and fair. The panelists were nice and patient . They granted me extra time. The questions were directly related to the job description. Three main questions with probing questions in the middle
Interview Questions: Technical questions in relation to the title

title: NATIONAL YOUTH VOLUNTEER Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and the interview it self was only thirty minutes. It was over zoom and wasn’t as stressful as it may seem. Just go in confident, calm, and you’ll do great
Interview Questions: Job Experience relating to job and why you want to work there

title: Marketing Executive Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual with three people. It was lovely and friendly however, their feedback was much harsher than was made out by them. The interview lasted nearly an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you dealt with a difficult colleague

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: No written test, only online interview. The interviewer provided feedback afterwards: Interview was well done but process was to regularize a temporary staff member. Was invited to apply for other positions.
Interview Questions: Interest in the position, relevant experience, a technical question and 2 competency questions.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview at the UNICEF Headquarters in New York was structured using the STAR Method (a competency-based one). Therefore, answering by selecting a situation where you achieved great result will should you get the job.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us in details one moment where you had to manage multiple tasks at the same time and how you did it?

title: Oficial De Protección Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Ciudad de Mexico) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Muy profesionales en el desarrollo de la entrevista, las preguntas son muy complejas, debes estudiar mucho sobre el tema y conocer conceptos y áreas prácticas del tema pues quienes evalúan son personas con muchos conocimientos y experiencia.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Ḩawwārah, Amman Governorate) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process was accelerated as they said they needed someone the next week. For this reason, I accepted an interview on a Sunday afternoon, canceling my plans for that day. While they said it was an informal call, I was speaking for an entire panel that was asking for my approach, methodology etc. After the interview, I never heard back from them.
Interview Questions: - What is your experience in managing stakeholders - How would you start this assignment

title: Community Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Stoke-on-Trent, England) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was competency-based interview questions and was very friendly and the questions were about communications in the Financial Innovation work. There was a lot of focus on financial innovation, research, and presentation. Very tough overall.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a complex communications challenge you have been faced with. How did you face it and what was your challenge

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was hard to pass. There were three stages including exam. Human resources and technical interviews made by team. It was competency based interview. They asked me five or six questions.
Interview Questions: How is your carreer match with this position?

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: There were 4 interviewers, offline in their office, and went for 30-60 minutes. They responded to you quickly and you'll be called in a week if you pass the interview
Interview Questions: describe yourself why choose fundraiser

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Neutral, nothing our of the ordinary. The speed in communicating was good, the entire process took a little over 6 weeks. I had one written assessment and one interview before being informed of the outcome.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background and why you applied to this.

title: Programme Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Aden) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of two parts, an automated video assessment and an oral interview. The automated interview had two questions and each question was allocated five minutes of recording time. the automated interview also allowed you to repeat the question once. The questions were fair enough and were context specific . The oral interview was competency based and took about forty minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience specifically highlighting your achievements and why you think you are the best person to get the job ?

title: Fundraising Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bangkok) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through UNICEF website. Waited for 3 weeks until they sent the invitation to take technical assessment. Technical assessment consisted of 3 questions mostly on how to convince donors to give contribution, how to secure continued contribution, how to address donor's concerns and how to overcome those concerns, give example on how UNICEF deals with others companies and how was the results - you can see that some are quite technical to those new to the position. Disturbing things happening here. There were 3 candidates including myself on Teams meeting and I could see all their names appearing on my laptop for the whole time we took the test (Been asked to open VDO but can mute). After I finished the task I googled the other candidates and one of them is already a Fundraising Specialist for years at UNICEF!!! As an organization believing in Integrity, Transparency, Accountability blah blah I can't imagine how the other candidates are going to be treated equally, let alone fairly. Considering one candidate has been doing the same job and gaining access to UNICEF's grant proposals, letter of intentions, etc for years I think this recruitment process is just a joke. I would love to hear from someone from UNICEF to tell me my understanding has been wrong.
Interview Questions: Have not been invited yet as I just took the assessment today.

title: Programme Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Interview was competency based, no written less than an hour. There was no written test. Technical competencies were evaluated but not extensively. The post interview processes took long but eventually cleared.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult task you have undertaken and how did you manage it

title: captador de clientes Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UNICEF (Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Entrevista com o gestor em um coworking perguntando sobre suas experiências com vendas, clientes. Posteriormente, apresentam a ONG e pedem para se apresentar, explicam tudo sobre como abordar e o conceito e a importância do pitch. Após a entrevista, é certo sua contratação.
Interview Questions: Possui experiência com a captação?

title: Communications Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: The interview process comprised of three stages. The aptitude test, written test, and oral interview. I didn't get shortlisted for the 3rd stage. Overall, I felt like all the stages were unnecessary
Interview Questions: 1. Aptitude tests 2. Written tests

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Must submit required documents with methodology note and financial bid. Based on shortlisting of CV, a technical note and financial bid, selected candidates are called for an interview. The interview lasts around 20 to 40 minutes, largely on technical knowledge with some experiences of working in the field or with the government
Interview Questions: Q What are the challenges for girls education in Rajasthan and how a programme can address them Q Reflect on an example where I found difficult to achieve the result and how I managed that situation

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly straightforward process with three rounds of interviews - the first was the application, the second a written round and the third, a virtual strategic assessment with a panel.
Interview Questions: Past experience with M&E, which was specific to the role.

title: Nutrition technical facilitator ( MD ) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: I want to work in the nutrition sector . for more than four years with the UNICEF IN Afghanistan in par wan province as NE ( nutrition technical facilitator ) i cover 92 HFs in part of nutrition IPD-SAM , OPD-SAM , OPD - MAM .GM , technically working , on the job training , supportive super visions , for Doctors , nurses , Mid wife , Chs
Interview Questions: MUAC for SAM , MAM children 6 -59 month sD ?

title: Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a panel. Compétences based interview then you need to prepare situations from your previous experiences to share with them. It last for almost 1 hour. In English language.
Interview Questions: Give us examples on team work, initiative, managing education projects etc

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Santiago) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Entretenido, preguntas distintas a un proceso regular. Se nota que leen tu CV y se interesan por conocerte más allá de tu experiencia. Una persona es de RRHH y otra es del departamento donde harás el internship.
Interview Questions: Sobre qué aprendiste en tus experiencias pasadas.

title: Giga Mapping Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the portal and about 6 weeks later was contacted for an initial interview. I followed up after the interview but I received zero response. I understand UNICEF has a large pool of candidates and they state that they don't respond to every applicant. However, I think if they have interviewed someone, they should provide a definitive response.
Interview Questions: I had to prepare a case study, share it with a panel, and then they asked me some competency-based questions. The one that sticks out is "give an example of when you have failed and how did you deal with failure."

title: Data Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It is a phone informal interview of 15 mins, and HR was very kind in attitude and words. The whole process was very relaxed, and he asked a few questions.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me about your Python experience 2. Tell me when you deal with team problems 3. What is your salary expectation?

title: Health Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was good and was a competency based interview in which no focusing on a technical side rather than on the skills and management knowledge. It last about one hour .
Interview Questions: Introduce your self and what value will you add to this position

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview and was told I’d hear back within 2 weeks. I never heard from anyone despite making the time to follow up a month later. Pretty poor approach to interviews. Complete time wasters and disrespectful of your time.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the role?

title: Wash Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Competency interview Sets high standards for quality of work; monitors and maintains quality of work; works in a systematic, methodical and orderly way; consistently achieves project goals; focuses on the needs and satisfaction of internal and external partners; accepts and tackles demanding goals with enthusiasm.
Interview Questions: what is drive for result skills

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Easy, engaging, 30 minutes long. They asked questions about my motivation for the position, why I wanted to join UNICEF and what I could bring to the team. Overall, a very quick and easy interview processes
Interview Questions: What is your motivation to join UNICEF?

title: Consultant Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: After doing a practical test, there was an online interview with the Tech Lead, Marketing Lead, and UX Designer. It lasted about 20 minutes. The Tech Lead seemed distracted during the process.
Interview Questions: They asked me about strengths, weaknesses, why I would like to work with them. They also asked me to show samples of my work during the interview .

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Karāchi) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: CBI Competency Based Interviews questions and answers with examples on different tools, techniques and methodologies to decide for further decision making. What is Sanitation marketing. Water, Sanitation and hygiene methods
Interview Questions: CBI Competency Based Interviews questions and answers

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
competence based interview avec la chef de section et le chef de bureau. duration  de 45 minutes. 
environ 4-5 questions avec des requestions apres chacune. En general tres gentil mais pas faciles les questions. Une fois jái du recommencer la reponse avec les indications recues par la chef de la section education
Interview Questions: competency based on education and project management

title: ICT Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was great, insightful and really probed in ones experience, skills, capabilities and an insight in there work experience. By analysing there computer knowledge, cloud computing as well as LAN knowledge, configuration
Interview Questions: Cloud computing and examples if any

title: Project Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: As usual telephonic Interview is organized by HR, and  interview board is composed of 4-5 members including  Head of Office/Regional Office, Program Officer, sister UN organization representative, Technical Expert, Communication Officer(optional) & HR support officer.
Interview Questions: In general interview atmosphere is very cordial. They try to understand your work experience, and try to understand how you handled a situation that the organization faces while working in the field. Your operation skill, managerial skill, UNICEF branding and team building capacity is judged through various questions, queries and situational analysis type of question. It varies from 40-60 minutes approx.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: UNICEF is one of the biggest UN agencies. The interview was not difficult but it needed some preparation.. it lasted around thirty minutes or so. It focused on the competencies and past experience.
Interview Questions: Mention three things that best describe you.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: the application procedure is the standard for all other application procedures elsewhere. relatively long and cumbersome but not a big deal. you need to fill out or answer so many areas
Interview Questions: do you have work experience outside of your home country

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Talent pool info session first, then online interview with 3 persons involved in the discussion. 1 HR person, 1 from the relevant team, 1 more senior member from an other team. They were kind and curious, the interview was fully hold in English.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between policy and procedure?

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Kigali, Kigali) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was a volunteer role for which I was invited to attend an interview, and was subsequently asked to submit samples of my past work. The interview itself went very well, with two members of the UNICEF communications team in attendance, as well as another representative from UNV.
Interview Questions: I cannot recall the specific questions, but they were mainly related to my experience, and mostly centered around graphic designing. The main question that kept coming up was, "Why should we choose you, and why do you think you deserve the role?"

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: For both the staff and unv positions, i applied for the interviews were competency based focusing on examples of work experience. The questions seem easy but the interviewers are looking details and achievements
Interview Questions: Tell us about time you worked in team to achieve something

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Very nice process. I felt comfortable, the team was interested in both personal and professional skills. They were looking for a young professional with demonstrable experience in the field. The interview took around 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: What challenges I can identify about the context

title: Human Resources Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Budapest) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: As an Internal candidate on Talent Pool: first I had a written test and interview to be considered for the Talent Pool, and I had an interview for the actual position with the Section Chief.
Interview Questions: Blended interview, real life experience and hypothetical behaviour in given situations

title: Senior Newborn Maternal and Child Health Specialist (Pro Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
Process took two months 
called  out by HR officer, references reached out by HR
No written test but interview test with hiring manager, officer from the unit and HR officer
Interview Questions:
questions on how to handle a conflictual situation?
questions on how to handle a conflictual situation?
time were you have to solve a difficult situation in your job?
what would you add to our organization?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: it was very smooth and recruiting did not take a lot of time. a maximum of 2 weeks after the date of the interview. no exams were conducted for an internship position.
Interview Questions:
- weakness and strengths 
- where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Communication Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Competency-based interview. Includes both interview and written test. Test was in accordance with the job description. Interview panel of several people, questions in line with the job description and with expectations for candidate experience.
Interview Questions: Always some version of why you are interested in the job or the best candidate for the job or describe yourself and how your qualifications meet the requirements.

title: F2F Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was a three step intervie,basic questions on a phone call , on zoom they asked everything in details and a small task outdoor. They also wanted a motivational video when you are applying for the job
Interview Questions: What ispired you for the position?!

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Only had one interview, but was contacted, interviewed, and rejected within a few weeks - so a pretty short process overall. Interviewers were warm and no gotcha questions. They seemed to really want previous UN experience, as most UN agencies do.
Interview Questions: How would you approach X project?

title: Marketing Executive Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: An easy going conversation with a panel of 4 interviewers. Great questions to be expected at all interviews such as describing a marketing campaign and how I was involved, company values and culture, overcoming difficult obstacles and building relationships.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Interview was poorly managed and members had no technical background, questions was mainly scenarios with very few analytical information. The did not follow the concept of competency based interview. it was online and they were late 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Real scenario of project design.

title: Junior Professional Officer (JPO) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Intro, personal history, technical questions, thematic questions, managment questions always in context to a real experiance from the past. Crazy thing was I had to provide 4 references within 24  hours!
Interview Questions: Have you had an issue with a supervisor, how did you deal with it and what did you learn from this experiance?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared to interview with folks in vastly different time zones as well; the reviews give some insight however the process is mercurial and protracted.  This interview was for a contract gig that spanned over 3-4 months and in the end it appeared that the hiring personnel/decision-makers were not in agreement on the role.  The role was reposted online for applications shortly after I was not invited to the 3rd round of interviews.
Interview Questions: How do you network across industries?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was good and my interviewers were friendly. Not too hard question and was straight to the point. Tell us about yourself and why are you the best? It was overall good and great
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Astana) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: was given a written task to perform within 24 hours, which was to develop a plan of action for the statistical analysis. There were 3 questions in total in the task
Interview Questions: Describe step by step the plan for statistical analysis

title: RRHH Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (Buenos Aires) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fue una entrevista amena, lástima la demora para el resultado.Así y todo fue una experiencia enriquecedora. Una gran institución internacional, con mucha proyección en él área para desarrollar. Parecía un buen ambiente de trabajo.
Interview Questions:
Experiencia en la posición 
Carrera estudiada
Posgrado
Aspectos de crecimiento

title: READ Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
A very long process, apply well in advance! 
-first application: a CV and letter
-1 month later: invitation to a 3 hour quantitative / qualitative research assessment (to be done at home)
-1 month later: invitation to an interview, then immediately invitation to "follow up chat" the next day
-2.5 weeks later: the official offer, with requested start date in 2 weeks
Interview Questions:
3 questions, with a lot of follow-ups after each one:
1.  tell us about your motivation for applying to this internship, and the reasons why you would be a good fit
2. how do you organize yourself when you have a lot of work?
3. tell us about the last time you worked as part of a team (asked in another language I mentioned in my CV!)

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and detailed, focused on job related activities and duties.  I didn't wait long for feedback. I was relaxed and treated with respect from all panelists.  Very enjoyable experience and all the process.
Interview Questions: Questions related to the position. Describe a situation in which you did not agree with your superior and how you resolved it.

title: Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Contacted +1 month after I applied not via email. I almost questioned the legitimacy of it. The interview started with personal and experience questions, then proceed to directly asking the strategy for the roles, the detailed plan of actions (which was very shocking). It was intense and nerve-racking.  No case-based such as "If you were faced with..." at all. It was one of the most difficult and intense interview I've ever had.
Interview Questions:
- How will you overcome the challenge?
- What strategy will you plan to execute this program?
The questions are very detailed.

title: Senior Programme Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: No test, just a single interview with a line manager and a specialist. Both interviewers were late to start, and it took longer than the expected duration (over an hour). Focus was on subjective topics in relation to the job, which was interesting, but highlighted the lack of an objective focus. They took over 6 months to make a decision, by which time I'd already accepted another position
Interview Questions: What would be your short-term strategic focus in this position?

title: Procurement Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Competencies-based interview, 4 questions related to competencies relevant to the job plus follow-up questions. 1 question on motivation fit to the job. The process took about 1 hour with 2 interview panel members and one HR.
Interview Questions: 4 questions related to competencies relevant to the job plus follow-up questions

title: Protection Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very friendly and the targets of the interview were clear. The content of the questions was human-centered and focused on my ethics. The interview did not last very long.
Interview Questions: The questions were about my background, my targets, and future ambitions as well as focused on how I would act in a context of emergency.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Competency based or STAR interview. There is an interview panel with a few people and length is for around an hour.  You should answer with examples demonstrating the competency they are asking about.
Interview Questions: They asked about the competencies that were outlined in the job description/advertisement.

title: Logistics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Interview panel consisted of 5 people. Questions were mostly related to previous experience - I wouldn't call them traditional competency-based. Some were quite usual ones but a couple were, to my mind, very specific - requiring a knowledge that one could probably get only while working in the same environment as interviewers.
Interview Questions: Tell us why would you like to get this position

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, both very short and pointed; first was the Director and current intern, second was with the two team members I would actually support. All were very nice and easy to talk to
Interview Questions: Why did you apply? What would you like to get out of this internship?

title: Graduate Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Verry Intensive and nerve-racking. needs. a lot of practice to get the job. surrounded by elites. world bank at the bootm floor. tigght sercutiry.  yes, i recommend this company and position. this place serves great opportunity and highly valued worldwide.
Interview Questions:
1. what are your strengths?
2. what are your wekanesses>

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward with basic questions asked but also job specific questions asked. Be prepared to talk about experience directly related to the job description, as most of the interview was talking about related experiences with follow up questions asked
Interview Questions: How have you analyzed data in the past?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Kigali, Kigali)
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewers were 3 which is really amazing had a very clean and honest conversation with responsive conversations.
It was interesting with amazing conversations. They were very open to what they want in an intern.
Interview Questions:
How do I maintain my mental health?
How would I maintain a balance between and and work.

title: Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: competency based interviews about concrete scenarios that you recall from previous experiences - you need to prepare ahead and come with ready situations that demonstrate competencies mentioned in the TOR
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Social Policy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Competency Based Interview Format with a lot of scenario questions. Smooth but long interview process. Interviewer was hiring manager, who was very knowledgeable and friendly. It can be hard if you try to be spontaneous.
Interview Questions: Usual “tell me about a time when you….” kind of questions

title: Especialista en Desarrollo Social Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Buenos Aires) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fue un panel de 4 personas. Entrevista por competencias. Preguntas de priorizacion de trabajo, dificultades, conflictos, innovacion. En todos los casos se solicito dar ejemplos. Ademas se realozaron preguntas especificas del puesto.
Interview Questions: Un ejemplo en el que no hayas podido cumplir un deadline

title: Chargé De Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
- Motivations
- Cas Pratique sur le Marketing Particulier
Dans l'ensemble l'entretien était un échange relativement informel sans compter, bien sur, la partie étude de cas qui s'est avéré être beaucoup plus professionnelle. 
Je recommande aux postulants de bien se renseigner sur les missions du poste, savoir donner des exemples concrets s'avèrera être un grand atout.
Interview Questions:
- Pourquoi Unicef?
- Pourquoi vous et pas un autre?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was good at the beginning but it become difficult for me to answer all the required questions they had in the interview process  and I managed professionalism’s to get it .
Interview Questions: My previous experience with any humanitarian assistance

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very professional HR personnel. will walk you through all steps and reply to emails. The process is different, but can usually take around 3 rounds of interviews it's also lengthy and can take up to more than 4 months
Interview Questions:
what's your motivation to work with UNICEF
How are your skills relevant to the job description

title: IT Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Candidates shortlisted for a position may undergo an assessment, followed by a reference check and other processes depending on the position level, area of work, and office context. Candidate assessment techniques will vary according to the contextual and business needs of the hiring office.
Interview Questions: Mention types of loops and provide examples

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Written and panel nterviews.Written was to be submitted through a computer test. Subject matter experts took the thematic interviews. The writte  npapaer was analytical and presentation type. Interviews were virtual and brief.
Interview Questions: How would you strategise the malnutrition reduction if the district

title: Programme Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1-shorlisting 2- pre-assessment with questions around the job description areas and PowerPoint preparation with a deadline to share by email 3-Interview including PowerPoint presentation and motivation questions Presentation in English and questions in French (or vice versa)
Interview Questions: Tell us more about yourself? Why are you applying in an emergency country? Questions on some aspects of the presentation? (like Competency based Interview) What would you do differently? What did you learn? What enabled you to succeed

title: Human Resources Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: I have applied online through UNICEF's job site where I have had to complete an application form, essentially uploading the information of my CV to this platform. I have been contacted 1 month later for an invitation for a  written test. It was a competency-based written test sent via scheduled email with 4 questions all related to only one specific field of Human Resources and only one part of the tasks related to the position as per the job description. I was given 1 hour and 15 minutes to review the questions and respond. The questions were very specific to the organizations' recruitment policies and were difficult. The evaluation of the test took another 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: make recommendations on how to attract IT talent and strengthen the candidate pool, draft email responses for specific queries by candidates, put together a recruitment plan

title: Estagiário Voluntário Interview

Devido a grande quantidade de pessoas e a dificuldade com a plataforma escolhida, a entrevista torna-se muito confusa e inefetiva.
Interview Questions:
Qual o seu estilo de trabalho?
Como funciona em trabalhos em grupos?
Quais sua qualidades? E seus defeitos?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The questions were very general, even though I prepared for a competency-based interview. I was nervous but the panel were very warm and friendly.  My interview was done on Zoom.
Interview Questions:
How can we improve our website?
What are your strengths?
Why UNICEF?
How do you manage your time?

title: Admin Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It is meant to be competency based so any answer can be considered very good or very bad based on the interviewer point of view and why not hidden agenda.
Interview Questions: All hypothetical situation where you can explain what would you do or have done in similar situations.

title: Comunicación Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really Simple and straight forward. I was very nervous but once i got there it was so easy and simple. I learned a lot. The interview was really Simple and straight forward. I was very nervous but once i got there it was so easy and simple. I learned a lot
Interview Questions:
What are your biggest strengths
What would you do in a particular case of conflict at work
How do you manage tight deadline

title: Policy Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I first gave a written test which was a take-home test and took three hours followed by a face to face interview (online) and then I submitted my references and writing sample. They spoke with my references via video chat and then made a decision. The whole process took about three months.
Interview Questions: Previous experiences and lessons learned from them

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Took 4 weeks and in between two interviews, reference checks and offer, depend on the nature of works other positions can take up to 2 months long before the decision is made
Interview Questions: Competance based questions on Management or working with people

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: CV and cover letter had to be sent through a specific portal. After I was requested to do a written Test. The test took place at a specific date and time and I was asked to submit a PowerPoint presentation and answer a question regarding the area concerning the internship. After that I was invited to an interview through zoom of about 30 minutes
Interview Questions:
Considering  the job description,how would you think you could use your strengths gained in past experiences and how do you think your weaknesses might impact?
What is your understanding of Accountability to affected populations?
Can you tell us a specific situation where you had to prioritize your tasks and coordinate a team to deliver those tasks?

title: Captador donantes Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNICEF (Buenos Aires)
Interview Descriptions: Me pusieron a Prueba haciendo como si tuviera que captar un donante y darle los motivos del porque se tiene que unir a unicef y donar todos los meses con la trjeta de credito
Interview Questions: Porque te gustari trabajar aca

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Libreville) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Candidature sur la plateforme suivi d'un entretien en ligne moins de 1 mois après la clôture des candidatures. L'entretien s'est fait en ligne . Il y avait un panel de trois personnes avec des questions assez simple sur la mission.
Interview Questions: Parlez de votre parcours et du lien avec la mission

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Colloquio su Skype con il responsabile della sezione per cui facevo application. Colloquio in Inglese, poco formale e lui mi ha messo subito a mio agio. Mi ha chiesto cose sul mio CV e sulla lettera motivazionale e poi gli ho fatto delle domande sul lavoro in questione.
Interview Questions: What do you know about UNICEF?

title: Marketing Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: Structured, formal interview. Not much conversation, strictly business. There were people from the team and one from HR at the panel interview. Why do you want to work for us. Some questions specific to the role.
Interview Questions: Why UNICEF? Why should we choose you?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: A thorough interview process starting with a phone interview, followed by a timed exam (remote from home), and two interviews. Everyone involved was friendly and considerate. I felt they were serious about finding the right candidate based on multiple skill sets.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked cross-functionally to achieve a goal.

title: Consultant Specialist I Year Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: A panel interview with five interviewers. They asked pretty standard questions about past experience and competencies related to the job description. The interviewers were friendly and it lasted 30 minutes.
Interview Questions:
Why do you apply to this job at UNICEF? 
Tell me a time when you led a campaign in innovative ways.

title: Associate Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Blended interview with technical and competency based questions.
The interview took approximately 45 minutes and the panelist’s requested to provide details about past scenarios in which I had to apply my soft skills plus some technical questions
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time you had to implement a social media strategy
Tell us about a time when you had to deliver results under stressful circumstances

title: District Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UNICEF (Rānchī) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Question releated to development sector was asked
Interview panel has 5 member
Interview was conducted in the college. 
There were only one round of interview. 
Ques releated to social mobilization. 
Why to join development
Communication for development
Interview Questions:
About social marketing
Social mobilization activities
Communication for development

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The first round consisted of completing a technical test (to be completed before the video call interview) which assessed my knowledge of the sector and asked me to create a short slide presentation with my recommendations for the stakeholders I would be working with in the role. They also asked for an example of a previous tool I had designed for the target community. These documents were to be emailed back two days before our scheduled interview.

During the interview, which was with three members of the team in total, they gave me some scenarios the hired consultant might experience and asked me how I would respond in those scenarios.
Interview Questions: Please share your experience managing stakeholders.

title: Administrative Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with two managers, it went quite well. After a week I reach out to them and they said that I was the most promising candidate that they have and will discuss the role further with me. And ultimately end up ghosting me after several efforts. Says alot of the people and culture of UNICEF India.
Interview Questions: Situational base questions.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: the interview was short, half for self-introduction and half for the question "what can you bring to us". Following the self-introduction, the interviewer may ask some questions about detailed work experience
Interview Questions: what can you bring to us

title: Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
Approximately 3 month after my application, I was invited for a written test. As I was out of my base country, I took the test in another country office. I completed the test and they did not even get back to me. 

I can understand because of time strain HR may be only able to inform shortlisted candidates. But I think short listed candidates needs to learn about the outcome of the test.
Interview Questions: -What's the biggest challenge education system faces?

title: Custom Protection Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: From what I read, your company is one of the leaders in database and website security for large corporations. I read your list of clients on your website and saw multiple Fortune 500 companies mentioned, including Verizon and IBM. Beyond that, I recently had an informational interview with James from the Marketing team, after messaging him on LinkedIn, and he shared a bit about your company culture; mainly, the emphasis on collaboration and open interaction between different departments and groups. That’s something that sounds exciting to me and that I’m hoping to find in my next job. Can you share more about how you’d describe the company culture here?
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your last job

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: I did not like the interview process. They gave me two questions to answer and not enough time. I also wish it was an in-person interview. I had to write the answers.
Interview Questions:
What contributes to migration?
Draw a chart

title: Student Intern Interview

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8+ months. I interviewed at UNICEF (Kinshasa) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: l'entretien ce passer sur internet je répondais à des quêtions. ensuite j'ais enregistre mon compte Gmail  .des question étais ci difficile mais par mes compétence je répondais . nous somme passer a l'étape des dossier je déposer mon cv; ma lettres de motivation adresser au directeur de la ressource humaine de l'entreprise .
Interview Questions: avez vous déjà  embrancher Unicef emboucher quelqu'un

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process happened as it is described in online open resources. There were the hiring manager, HR representative, additional expert panel member. 

I was asked general questions and basic context-action-result questions. The interviewers were friendly. They were professional. Because of the specialized nature of the position I was applying for the interview did not seem to be the key determinant of hiring. 

Main tips: prepare for the interview reviewing UNICEF website, speak well and be confident.
Interview Questions: How did you solve a major problem in your past experience? What did you do and how it led to the result?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF

A Short phone interview was conducted. 
Then, email confirmation for an interview would be received.
Interview questions were mainly based on your CV (knowing more about your past working experiences and your career interest)
Interview Questions:
Why did you apply
What do you expect to achieve or be benefited
...

title: Internship Interview

title: Telemarketing Interview

title: Education Consultant Interview

Describe a time when deciding on an appropriate course of action required careful and
through review of complex and information from multiple sources

title: consultora Interview

title: Communication Officer Interview

title: Communications Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions:

board interview both English and Spanish

title: Internship Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Camarógrafo Interview

title: Education Officer Interview

Interview Questions: Tell us about one achievement in your earlier job

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: The process was straightforward, from the initial contact to invite to the interview. The discussions started off with my background and research interests and then I had an interview with someone more senior in which cases were discussed.
Interview Questions: What do you aim to have achieved by the end of the term?

title: Marketing Support Interview

Interview Descriptions: Temporary role advertised through a recruitment agency.   Agency submitted application and emailed interview link for an online zoom interview. Pleasant 1:1 interviewer but have never heard anything since from the agency so I guess I wasn't successful! A simple email on feedback would have been nice.
Interview Questions: Give an example of an occasion when you made a mistake,  what you did and what you learned.

title: Programme Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: The process generally consists of two steps. Written test to reduce the shortlist then oral interview in the form of CBI depending on language requirement and location, both steps can be in two languages

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer Interview

Interview Questions: do you speak any other languages?

title: Project Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Pleasant interview after I applied. 

Was told to hear back the result next week, never heard back. 

After six weeks and numerous contact attempts was told I was rejected.  

Overall, ok interview, but the lengthy process with too many applicants per place, as is the case with the UN always.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What can you bring to the job?

title: Promoter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Firstly they invite you for the on the job test on the street, and if you pass that they send you immediately to the office for another round with the manager of the whole department.

title: Immigration Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position, then a month later did an online exam of answering two essay questions in one hour, then a couple of weeks later did a phone interview for around 30 minutes. Received a decision one month late, got rejected because my reference forgot to send reference letter!!
Interview Questions:
Why work at UNICEF?
Describe your typical day?

title: Team Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: Competency-based online interview with a panel of 3 people - everyone was very nice. The questions were quite straightforward and I could drew from my previous experiences. After 1 week, I received a call informing that I was unsuccessful.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UNICEF UK?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very organized, structured, and the interviewers were nice. They asked only the questions directly related to the position. I received feedback in the promised time. Although the whole process is very formal and lengthy (considering the nature of the organization), the people involved are very professional.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you worked well under pressure.

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Geneva) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Shortlist , written assessment,  interview  , second interview 
The whole process took almost three months from application submission to get an offer.
The interview was over the Microsoft teams and the second was over the phone more related to technical stuff i.e SPSS, Statat, most of the question were from glassdoor and standbyroster.org website
Interview Questions:
Q1:  Please review the attached ‘Incidents.csv’ file for ACLED data on Morocco.  Please identify the following:
1)  How many total incidents of Riots/Protests and Violence against Civilians were there in the period 2000 to 2010, inclusive. 
2)  Using Google Docs, make a bar graph showing Riots/Protests and Violence against Civilians per year for the whole dataset.  The graph should communicate both the total number of incidents (Riots/Protests + Violence against Civilians) as well as the totals for each category
3)  Write a paragraph describing an approach to automating the production of this graph.

title: UNV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bonn) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 6 competency-based questions, very specific to the country context and rather technical. Overall, it was pretty friendly but it required a lot of country-specific prep, the usual strategy on how to prepare for a competency-based interview didn't quite work for me. Knowing this now, I would've tried to get my hands on the programme documents.
Interview Questions: Country specific technical programme questions

title: Full Time Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: A long but positive process. Well, thought-through questions and a friendly interviewing panel. It took around 2 months from the interview to a job offer. Only one round of interviews was involved.
Interview Questions:
- Interest in the positions.
- Previous experience with similar jobs. 
- 3 technical questions.
- Knowledge of the region. 
- Understanding of global priorities on the topic.

title: Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: Written test
Step 2: Skype interview
Step 3: Certificates checked in person
Step 4: Offer
(Step 1 was in Jan- offer received in May)

The interview was technical. Panel of 3 people. 2 people from the technical field 1 person from HR.
Interview Questions:
Relevance of RTE
Experience of managing teams
Experience of mitigating field challenges
And other competency based Qs

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview takes about 30 minutes and though Zoom. There will be 3 people asking the questions. Mainly, they are trying to see if you are the best candidate to do the job. The result is quite fast, after several days from the interview.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Focussed on past experiences and taking questions from two or more people.  There is often, but not always, a very deferential approach to the hierarchy.  Consultants are, apparently, not subjected to the requirement for regional equity that staff positions are.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Communication for Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
First call: initial screening
Second call: interview with a consultant
Third call: interview with the direct manager

Mostly all behavioral questions were asked at each interview and specific questions about UNICEF as an organization.
Interview Questions:
Why are you the best candidate?
Walk me through your resume?

title: Accounts Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Copenhagen, Capital Region)
Interview Descriptions: Horrible experience. First step was assessment which I pass and then it was interview through zoom. It was strictly said there won't be camera through interview and then 3 minutes before start of interview they said we should use camera. I think that was also some kind of test, which I fail. I didn't want to use camera cause I didn't prepare myself . I had home clothes, without make up etc.
Interview Questions: Communication with other departments, with other people. Why you are for that job.. Some technical questions regarding accounting

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Intimidating in the beginning as interview was conducted with a panel of 4 people, but eased in to it as I drew from previous experiences to answer questions that were competency based.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a workshop

title: Programme Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Selection by the UNV plateform. Two weeks later, convocation for an interview. Interview by three people from the programme on skype. Duration:45 minutes. They were very kind to me. Interview directly in relation with the position. Technical questions.
Interview Questions: How I managed conflict situation by giving an example.

title: Contract Software Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application, a recruiter reached out over email a few weeks later and asked me to complete ~3 hours of technical work, and email them back my results. As a senior consultant, I don't typically do several hours of free work without even a phone call, but it's UNICEF, so I agreed. A week later, I was notified over email that I passed the technical interview, and went on to a soft-skills assessment, which was a 50 minute phone call. The questions were scenario based. It's been months, and I never heard back.
Interview Questions: Describe how you have handled this extremely specific specific situation in the past.

title: Junior Social Media Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: After a lengthy online application form, I was invited to participate in a technical test. Overall, the test took around 3-4 hours. After submitting the test, I received an email about a week later with an invitation to a 30-minute interview which was conducted by Skype audio. Questions were primarily technically-focused with a focus on examples of past projects and my specific roles within those projects. I received a notice that they had gone with another candidate about a week later.
Interview Questions:
Have you worked on a remote team in the past? 

What is a communications challenge you had to overcome? 

Have you ever had something go wrong? What did you do? What was your specific role?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Online test followed by competecny interview. Interview was conducted by HQ staff and they also required evidence to show resourceful skills. Online test followed by competecny interview. Interview was conducted by HQ staff and they also required evidence to show resourceful skills.
Interview Questions: Frameworks for solving humanitarian crisis.Frameworks for solving humanitarian crisis.

title: Public Partnerships Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: The first round was completely automated and asked me to complete a case study.  The second round was a virtual interview with real people.  HR informed me that I was not selected.

title: Consultant Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Temporary Assistant Interview

title: Corporate Partnership Interview

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF

title: , Communications Interview

title: ESTÁGIO Interview

title: Intern - Monthly Interview

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: One interview was done by phone, one interview done by skype, both technical and logistical questions. There was only another candidate. The recruitment is based on your experiences but also your motivations and what you know of the organization.

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Topic sentences are similar to mini thesis statements. Like a thesis statement, a topic sentence has a specific main point. Whereas the thesis is the main point of the essay, the topic sentence is the main point of the paragraph. Like the thesis statement, a topic sentence has a unifying function. But a thesis statement or topic sentence alone doesn’t guarantee unity. An essay is unified if all the paragraphs relate to the thesis, whereas a paragraph is unified if all the sentences relate to the topic sentence. Note: Not all paragraphs need topic sentences. In particular, opening and closing paragraphs, which serve different functions from body paragraphs, generally don’t have topic sentences.
