title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I apply, get the invitation for written test after few days. Wait for 2 week to take the written test and then the interview. Everything takes around 3 months.
Interview Questions:
1. Describe the time when your team has to collaborate with other team. What was the challenge and how you encourage the collaboration to take the initiative?
(Competency: Working with people)


2.  Explain the time when you have to adjust your team plan due to unanticipated challenge?

(Competency: Planning and Organizing)

3.  Describe a situation when you have to push yourself to achieve a demanding goal?

(Competency: Drive for Results)

title: Assistant Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview consists of written test and an interview.  there are usually 10 persons selected for the written test and 4 persons are called to the interview. the interview is usually with HR, manager and one more person and it is competency based interview. you can look up the qs on the internet.
Interview Questions: the written interview had 5 questions: 4 related to a project proposal ( realize budget, make  a note for the specialist to sum up the project, what are the missing pieces of the project and how to make it better). the interview is competency based interview. and they analyze communication, drive for results, working with people, planning, knowledge.

title: FACE To FACE FUNDRAISER Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Melbourne) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. Casual conversation, good atmosphere. I was offered the job but had to decline because the travel distance was too far. Overall positive experience, might apply again is the job location is closer.
Interview Questions: What makes you mad? (e.g. unfair situations)

title: UNICEF Face to Face Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Melbourne) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I attended a group interview to be a fundraiser with UNICEF. Casual chat, good atmosphere. I got the job but decided to decline as the travel distance was too far. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: What makes you mad? (e.g. unfair things in the world)

title: Production Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process lasted just over an hour in their main London. I was interviewed by 2 members of staff who were polite and friendly. The interview felt informal and relaxed which was good.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you overcame a challenge

title: Global Citizenship Fellowship Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 months. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted my application toward the end of 2015 (December I believe). Did not hear back until the end of January for a preliminary interview with a recruiter based in NYC. I was then recommended for the next step, which was a Skype interview.  Time went on and I did not hear back. Finally, in April/May 2016 I received an email stating that I was a finalist. 

I was invited to the Boston office to give a presentation and meet the staff. I live in another state so I paid for my non-reimbursable flight/hotels (silly of me,  I know).  After the interview, tI received 2 more phone calls:  one from the HR and another from one of the interviewers in Boston. They called my 2 references and told them I would without a doubt hear back in a week.

Well guess what? I never heard back. Followed up: nothing. Silence, silence and silence. 
It's fine if I didn't get the position.. But to drag a person through a LENGTHY several month application process and not have courtesy to follow-up is absolutely enraging. 

Companies always expect candidates to have decorum and open communication.. etc. But when a revered org like UNICEF cannot reciprocate that, it speaks volumes.

Everytime I share this experience with someone, they are absolutely appalled. 

Throughout entire 4-5 months I received nothing but kindness. So why after the interview can you not have courtesy to follow-up.

It was not until 3 entire months later that I received a generic reply. 

For almost a year, I beat myself up over this. The rejection is not what bothers me-- it is the lack of respect for candidates after a long application process.
Interview Questions: You had to pitch an idea to the interview panel

title: Human Resources Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Budapest) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application, I was called within 3-4 weeks. They called me without being informed about in in advance. The questions were very general: What do you know about UNICEF, about HR work at UNICEF, about GSSC, why do you want to work here, how would you see your future here, why do you think you are fit for this job, what do you know about it?
Interview Questions: What do you know about UNICEF, about HR work at UNICEF, about GSSC?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Cleared aptitude test and technical test easily and then was called for technical test. Successfully cleared the technical test and was selected for HR round and then was asked for filling out the feedback form and when filled the feedback form and was waiting for HR interview. Got to know that I got rejected without being interviewed in HR round.
Interview Questions: Questions were average and only asked from your technical test.

title: Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Jakarta) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: the questions were very programmatic. it requires in depth research as your preparation. you may share about your experience but your planning strategy is really challenged. you may also need to reserach first about the hot issue in the government sector related to your position. in my case it was Musrenbang.
Interview Questions: skills

title: M&E Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Khartoum) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process lasted within a month. I was invited for a written interview and later on got short-listed for the oral interview via a phone. I received the final outcome after two weeks.
Interview Questions: Differentiate between monitoring and evaluatiob

title: Administrator In Communication for Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Abidjan)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Unicef contacted me 1 week later for a written test. We waited 1 hour in the garden outside because of an issue with their system. They never gave a feedback.
Interview Questions: Operational questions about the job (case study)

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: This position is under the UNV program. The process took total of a bit over 1 month. 2 weeks or so after my submission of application, I received an invitation to take a writing test (3 hrs). Writing test was pretty hard, a combination of all skills (program development, mngmt, budget planning/fundraising/investment case). About a month later, an interview (1.5 hrs) with 4 people (chief of program, program specialist, director of UNV in Vietnam, and an HR officer). A mix of technical and competence-based questions, very straightforward questions on the post and on past experience. A challenging but a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions:
Why this post, why this program?
Technical questions that align with the post (for e.g. For this post on maternal health, infant care, informatic skills,...)
Past experience that shows working in group, that shows a lesson learned, that creates a model to base other experiences on)

title: Face to Face Area Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Istanbul) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Candidates introduce each other as far as they can know to HR person.Afterwards HR tells about Unicef and its projects.Give us approx 15 min to prepare to project presentation which consist of both convincing the locals around workplace and talking well about projects.
And resume check question and introducing
Interview Questions:
Could you introduce yourself ?  
Project presentation roleplay

title: Door to Door Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Dublin, Dublin) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was greeted by an email, asking to confirm a day for my interview that turned out to be a group interview. There was 6 people on this occasion.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with rejection?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Still waiting to be invited for an interview. Not sure what to expect and what type of questions I will be asked, after all. The first step will include a technical assassment.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UNICEF in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of an online assessment, and interview. It lasted approximately 4 months and involved different levels of interaction with the regional HR team in preparation. The online resources that are widely available are also incredibly helpful.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for UNICEF?

title: Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Panama, OK) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in December 2016 the contacted me in February 2017 via phone call to give me a date and hour for the interview which was an online test, the time for finishing the test was 2 hours and it took me exactly that time to finish, they asked me 3 questions
Interview Questions: Make a press release involving UNICEF based on a story they give you,

title: Programmer Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 panel interviews + a last interview took place. First interview was held over phone, the panel was consisted of HR person, a person from a section, the supervisor, and one more staff member. Second interview was a bilateral with my supervisor. The final was just to check my acceptance. Overall, the interview followed the competency-based questions, not only technical knowledge, but more focused on how you have learned and how that experience can be applied to the current position.
Interview Questions: What was the biggest challenge in your previous position?

title: New Ventures Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Online application to even get to interview is really really lengthy, is online and requires a 1000 character answer for each competency from the JD, in this one there were 10 to get through.  Then also a 2000 character supporting statement based on their 7 common approaches. 

The actual interview, I was interviewed by 3 people when I was told it would be 2, they were running late and I found them pretty cold and difficult to connect  with.  I did a presentation in my interview and just found the atmosphere in there kinda odd.
Interview Questions: Some questions were a little odd and lengthy, the kind where you are asked 3 long questions in one go so by the time they finish asking, you've totally forgotten what was asked.  I was asked questions around insight, strategy, business planning.  I then never even heard back either way after the interview which I think is pretty poor. Interviews can be nerve wracking and require a lot of preparation, If felt like I really prepared for this interview so not to even get any answer from them is pretty disappointing.

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Dhaka)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired through a technical written test and  panel interview. I was first invited for a written test with twelve other applicants and tested for two and a half hours on HR issues.  Consequently  based on the test result I was invited for the interview,
Interview Questions: How did a resolve a conflict among to colleagues,

title: Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Applied via email. Received a response two weeks later. Conducted a half-hour phone interview. Then was called in for a 1 hour in person interview with a group of individuals. It seems they were asking competency based interview questions. Received a polite email about two or three weeks later stating that my application was no longer in consideration.
Interview Questions: They asked to give an example of when I had experienced a failure and how I handled it.

title: Website Maintenance Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Belgrade, Central Serbia) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, got contacted by their HR and got interviewed in UNICEF Belgrade office in February 2017.

Interview was about half an hour long. One tech person and the other two from management/hr. They went through my background and experience, what I do now and what can I offer. They explained what they need and compared that to my knowledge to see if I could start working in less then a week since no training would be provided.

The general tone of the conversation was good and welcoming. Even the compensation part.
Interview Questions: Do I own all the licences for the software I use.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview 3 months after submitting my resume. Phone interview with HR was pleasant. Did a 2-hour technical assessment that tests your skills in marketing strategy, branding  and proof reading. Didn't reach the face-to-face interview with hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Create a marketing plan based on the conditions provided.

title: Education Assessment Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process took 4 months, give or take. I applied on-line in November 2016, was invited to take a written test to be submitted in 2 hours. A couple of months later, I was invited for a skype  interview. That was the end of the process on my end because I am still waiting for the outcome.
Interview Questions: Questions were mostly based out off the kills and competencies of the job requirements.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UNICEF (Kano, Kano) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: typically phone calls with HR representatives to determine if applicants have the qualifications needed to do the job, one of the final steps prior to making a job offer is reference checks to  verify candidates’ employment details including job performance, strengths, and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me a little about yourself?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UNICEF (Kathmandu) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward phone interview with a panel of 3 people. As it was a consultancy role and not a full time position, the interview process was not as rigorous as usual.
Interview Questions:
- Why do you want to work for UNICEF? 
- What strategies would you employ for this project?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Round 1: Resume and cover letter
Round 2 (had two separate 30-45minute interviews): In person interview with department and then HR. The HR interview was fairly generic with mostly behavioural questions. The department interview was more conversational than I expected with back and forth questions about my experience and how that fit into UNICEF's work.
Interview Questions:
HR: strengths, weaknesses, resume questions 
Department: resume questions, previous experience, why UNICEF

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bangkok) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of 4 interviewers and based on competency interview, based on the job functions described in the position description and you are asked to come up with various scenarios from past experiences that speaks to each function.
Interview Questions: Based on your experience, name a task that you took lead and initiated and resulted in success.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Firstly I had a phone interview, talking about my experience with programming and data analysis. Then I had a online-test. I had to reply to them with results in 2 hours. It is not so hard but you need to be familiar with R programming. Then I went to their office to have a talk to each other.
Interview Questions: Manage child mortality data.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was an on-phone interview, both interviewees made it easy, they were nice and friendly.  it was a situational interview. they asked me to introduce myself, then describe situation where I used my teamwork skills, conflict management, and working with other departments.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you used your teamwork skills.

title: Public Affairs Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: Invited to interview at their London offices. Was asked to complete two written tasks, one was writing a letter to an advocacy target from the previous years report, the other was a brief to accompany the letter. The interview was with three members of staff good mixture of theoretical and practical questions
Interview Questions: What are the current long term issues facing the industry

title: Policy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: competency based interview and HR questions. a panel of specialists. They seemed to take the process seriously which is great. Skype interview wasn't great for inter-personal feel which is also important in determining whether you want to work with one another or not.
Interview Questions: Analysing skill, communication skills, closely linked to the job description and one should prepare examples close to the job description

title: Senior International Programmer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: About 1 week after sending the application online, I received an email saying I had been selected for an interview. The interview asked basic competency questions. A couple days later, I received an email stating I had made it to the written assessment stage. The written assessment was done at home with a two hour period. A few days after, I was contacted again for the final interview: a one hour Skype call with the supervisor of that dept, another advisor, and the human resources coordinator.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you juggled different information for different donors.

title: Asistente De Recaudación Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bogotá, Bogota) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
- Primero realicé unas pruebas técnicas para evaluar mi capacidad para dicho cargo. Esta prueba tomó 1 hora y me la enviaron por correo, así que no tuve que ir a algún lugar.
- Después tuve que hacer una prueba en inglés. Esta prueba tenia una sección de gramática y una entrevista. Tuve que asistir a un lugar especifico para hacerlo.
- Finalmente me citaron a una entrevista por competencias con un panel de 5 personas. Incluso me hicieron un par de preguntas en inglés. Esta entrevista la realicé en las oficinas de UNICEF en Bogotá.
Interview Questions:
Mencione una experiencia donde haya liderado un grupo.
Mencione una experiencia donde haya tenido que presentar resultados.
Mencione una experiencia donde haya fallado. Que hizo para solucionarlo.
Como manejaría una gran cantidad de información y como haría para identificar si la información es útil o no?

title: Consultancy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: A skype interview (audio only, no video) with a panel of 3 interviewers, one person from UNICEF and two from another organization that were involved in the specific terms of the consultancy interviewed me. A half hour was given for a scheduled call.
Interview Questions: They asked questions specific to the consultancy, in a competency-based manner (see UNICEF competency-based framework). I.E. As outlined in the TOR, this is the challenge that we are dealing with. How do you suggest that we move forward/in your opinion, what is the next step?

title: Wash Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (Kabul) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: One month after job application, I was invited for written assessment and moved to the next step for Competency Based Interview (CBT) by skype. 4 panel members and it took around 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: 1.	Give me an example of when you had to explain something difficult to someone who did not have your background/knowledge.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Email was swnt asking for availability for a phone interview. The phone interview was with a panel of three current employees asking different questions. It was a Skype interview but conducted like a phone call with no video.
Interview Questions: Hypothetical questions on how to handle challenges or issues that come up in projects

title: Media Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
Before the interview I was asked to write a press release based on information that was provided to me. The writing test lasted for 30 minutes.
I was then interviewed by three employees: head of communications, HR and another person on the communications team. 
The interview lasted about 20 mins. The interviewers took turns in asking the questions.
Interview Questions: They asked standard interview questions : competency etc., they also asked me about current affairs and news stories.

title: User Experience Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process is around one hour. My supervisor asked me to demonstrate my design projects and provide a possible solution for current projects in the unit. After the interview, she informed the good result in two days. And we went over all administrative paper around one month.
Interview Questions: How do you use your design skill to solve the problem in the limited resource and move the project forward?

title: Programmer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview for position in Kiev Ukraine was held in 3 or 4 stages, all remote - starting with email assignment, several skype conversations and written tasks on translation and organisational sckills. Very professional staff. All as described on their website.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with overcomming a difficult work situation?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Very straightforward and simple. Questions about experience and why you are interested in the job. A few follow-up questions were asked about prior experience. The whole process took about 4-6 weeks (this takes into account the Christmas holiday period). Interviewers were very courteous and helpful in answering questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UNICEF?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
Relatively straightforward: written assessment and phone interview
Written assessment was a mini test of taks to be performed during the internship, e.g. Writing an invitation letter to a UNICEF speaker and watching videos of council meetings and writing briefing notes.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position.

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: easy. The panel was friendly. I felt though, that I was being unprepared. 4 people were on the panel all from different sections. All took turns to ask why I wanted the job
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Fundraising Specialist P4 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: For the first selection, a task was emailed to all candidates at a set time. we were given 1.5 hours to complete the exercise. The job was related to fund-raising in a particular sector. I received the offer for the first selection around 2 months after the closing date. Over 2 months after the initial test, I still have not heard anything back from UNICEF  (negative or positive) despite calling HR. I was told their process was slow but I was at least expecting a reply given i made it to the first selection.
Interview Questions:
What should be the key elements of UNICEF’s Strategy in sector xxx?
What KPIs should UNICEF’s xxx Strategy be evaluated against?
Given the broad nature of the role, how would you prioritise your time?

title: Short-term Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Almaty) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took nearly 30-40 minutes. Interviewer asked question in the beginning in English, then proposed to switch to Russian. By  the way there was only one interviewing person, no panel.
Interview Questions:
How do you deal with conflicts?
How do you work under pressure?

title: Philanthropy Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
There was a written assessment lasting 25 mins. This was a letter to a donor thanking them for their donation and asking them to donate again in 2016. A two page Unicef document was given to extract information from. 

This was followed by an interview with panel members. The interview was average-hard and the questions were competency based as well as a few role play questions of handling different work situations. There were about 10 questions in total and the interview lasted about 40 mins.
Interview Questions:
1. Why do you want the job?
2. How do you prioritize competing priorities?
3. What is your experience of using spreadsheets?

title: Porgramme Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: the entire interview is based on Competency Based Interview questions. There were 5 questions covering a number of core and functional competencies, including Driving for Results, Team work, Embracing diversity, Innovation and Persuasion/Negotiation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the time when you had difficulties in managing a team?

title: Education Specialist NOC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Harare) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The technical  written test required me  to demonstrate my knowledge  on Education statistics and  analysis. From a given data I was expected to compute Net Enrollment Ratios,Gross enrollment ratios and Gender Parity Indexes  and then do a trend analysis. The other essay-type questions elicited my understanding and knowledge on quality education indicators
Interview Questions:
This was a competency based question where I was required to demonstrate the competency on Formulating Strategies and Concepts. 

Tell me about a time when you had to translate a work-related strategy into actions and plans. 
•	What did you specifically do that was effective? 
•	How did you know that your plans were clear enough to be implemented? 
•	What would you do differently in hindsight? 
2. Tell me about a time when you were involved in developing a strategy for your department or organization. 
•	What was your role? 
•	How did you approach this situation? 
•	Who else was involved? 
•	What challenges did you experience? 
•	How did it turn out? 
3. Tell me about a situation when you had to ensure that a particular project within your department was aligned with organizational strategy. 
•	Why was this important? 
•	How did you approach the situation? 
•	What was the outcome?

title: GSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy hiring process spanning 6 months, which began in September and Letter of Intent being sent in March. Which included 1 Written Test, 1 HR round, and Final Issuance and Acceptance of Job Offer
Interview Questions:
A. HR - Introduction about myself  and What makes me fit for the role applied?
B Manager - 2 Situation based Queries, 2 Analytical Questions, 1 Logical Reasoning 
C. HR - Asked me if I have any questions for them.

title: Digital Marketing Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: One hour-long interview,it was competences based with 3 people asking questions and writing down answers. Not too much interaction, it's definitely not a chat. I felt quite uncomfortable. I was not selected for the job and never had a feedback on my interview. Overall quite stressful.
Interview Questions: can you tell me a time when you missed a deadline

title: Creative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Computer based test + panel interview. 

Task:
copy editing (edit 200 words from a 1500 words document)
select an interesting fact from the document
select an image
create a facebook post

Interview:
The panel was friendly and approachable
Interview questions were primarily competency based: relevant experience, project management, priorities, collaboration, communication, dealing with conflicts, etc

Suggestion:
Preparation is key. Research about Unicef work, their audiences, tone of voice and brand.
Interview Questions: Main differences between printed information and digital communications

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Three people called in 30 mins. First one asked general questions about your background and interest. Second one told me there were 3 roles suitable for me and asked me if I was interested. The third one tole me I can fit in a lil and asked me if I was interested.
Interview Questions: Did you get interview anywhere before?

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview is typically conducted via Skype or phone.  In most cases it follows the Competency-based Interview structure.  Following the brief introduction on the post, interview panel members and procedure, interviewers take turn to ask 3-4 questions on particular competency areas that they consider relevant to the post.
Interview Questions:
Question 1: Formulating Strategies and Concept
• Explain the experience when you had to translate a work-related strategy into actions and
plans
• Describe the situation and your particular role in particular the followings:
o What were the unique elements in the situation and your task?
o What were the key challenges?
o How did you approach to increase effectiveness?
o What would you do differently in hindsight?

Question 2: Analyzing 
• Describe a time when deciding on an appropriate course of action required careful and
through review of complex and information from multiple sources
o Briefly describe the situation and your task
o Which sources did you exactly analyze?
o What strategies were generated as a result of the analysis
o What were the particular challenges?

Question 3: Relating and networking
• Describe a time when you initiated and developed an effective working relationship with key
stakeholders
o Why was the networking important?
o How did you establish the working relationship?
o What were the particular challenges?
o What would you do differently in hindsight?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the position and was offered a position. Let me tell you that their hiring process is obnoxiously long. There were many required documents which I submitted as soon as I was told about them weeks after I was offered the job. I couldn't not meet the insurance requirement but no one contacted me to tell me that this would mean the job offer is not valid. I was notified of this weeks after I submitted my final documents and had checked out and cleared all of my references (all of whom also had to fill out paperwork).
Interview Questions: What is the difference between SharePoint 2010 and 2013?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward. I was interviewed by two people who asked normal interview questions, such as how do you work when under a deadline, and how do you work with people of different races and cultures?
Interview Questions: How do you work under pressure?

title: AYEP Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (Tirana, Tirane) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply through UNICEFs portal and submit your P11. After 5 months of wait you get a test which is a very difficult exam and then 2 months later you get a competency based interview. Time is one of their weakest pointd as it takes way too long for the recruitment process fron start to finish. The panel was made up of 4 people, including an officer from the regional office who was present through skype.
Interview Questions: The 7 Cs of resilience

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Most posts go through a multi-level screening process - first general shortlisting at the Headquarters level, then a second level of short listing at the country office level.  This is usually followed by a written test to verify technical skills, and finally for those who pass through all of these levels of vetting, a competency based interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you had to translate a work-related strategy into actions and plans. 
What did you specifically do that was effective?

title: UNV Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Hard, all sorts of questions. I showed passion and commitment and it was highly valued. The type of interview in any UNICEF selection process is competency based interviews. There is  panel of evaluators, and each member of the panel asks questions. The interview could be in different languages, according to what is mentioned in your CV.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflcts.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. They arranged a test with others candidates. The test specialized on technical contents. Quite interesting questions, with case studies. Not too challenging but required deep understanding on topics.
I'm waiting for the next round. They told us that they will inform us soon, in 1 or 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: How to solve the problem stated.

title: Programmer Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Competency based interviewing - easy if you know how.  Google "UN Competency Based Interviewing" for help.  Easy when you know how.  All the questions start with "Tell me about a time when you..."....and will be related to the "Core competencies" listed in the job description.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult ethical situation
Tell me about a time when you had to communicate a difficult concept to someone who didn't have that knowledge..

title: Planning Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: When submitting the application there were around 10 eliminatory screening questions on UNICEF in general. The second round was then conducted through a software called "Interview Master" where your language skills (the UN languages you indicated), technical knowledge (through a very difficult multiple choice test) and writing/stress skills relevant for the post (a written test with 10 pages of reading and strategic summarizing) were tested. The third and final round was an interview via skype/phone with a panel of 3-4 people.
Interview Questions: UN competency questions relating to project management experience, working in multicultural teams and reactions in difficult situations at work.

title: Research Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I completed the extensive online application, then was contacted via email to take a written test online at a certain date/time. At the time, they sent me a test with reference files, one of which was corrupted. I replied to alert the staffer, but they did not reply. 

I completed the 2+ hour written exam, sent it in, but HR neglected to send even a form letter rejection.  After a significant time investment, UNICEF lacked the common courtesy to ever send a reply.
Interview Questions: They sent me a batch of documents detailing a potential partner (via email, one of the files was corrupted and inaccessible) and asked that I draft a report recommending or declining a potential partnership.

title: Public Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (London, England) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Had to do a 15 minute test first: this involved drafting a short letter of thanks to a UNICEF supporter, and then prioritising 6 tasks with justification for their order.
Then the interview, which was a panel interview with 2 leaders of the Public Fundraising team for approximately 40 minutes. Generally competency based.
Qs:
1. Describe a time when you had to explain a complex concept to different audiences
2. Describe a time when you have had to juggle several commitments at once and how you managed your time
3. Describe a time when you had to organise an event and how you went about prioritising your time.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience and why you want to apply for the Community Fundraising role

title: Operations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Based on competency framework .reccomend to review the framework and get prepared.all behaviouru indicators are available in tbat document which makes it easy to prepare response.all should be based in real life examples
Interview Questions: Tell me about time when you had conflict with your supervisor

title: Individual Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a bit of a front. They're required to make it look like they're publicly advertising for a post and reviewing multiple candidates, even if they already have one person in mind. I was referred into the consultancy, but still had to go through the interview process, which was sending in standard materials to the potential employer, and then having a panel interview over Skype. Fairly easy interview because, again, it was a formality. Be cautious when applying to UNICEF posts, because they may or may not be actively looking for new applicants.
Interview Questions: If your previous employer had to describe you in three words, what would they be?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Almaty) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Competency based interview meaning that interview panel will examine the competencies of  incumbent by asking questions related to the competencies he/she should possess.
They invite you for written test if the amount of shortlisted candidates higher than 10 persons.
Interview Questions: why you think you are suitable for this position? or Why you have applied for this position? (this is introduction question, just to warm up the candidate)

title: Programmer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple. They got back to me with in one week . I was recruited through a recruiting agency so all the pre-screening was done by them. I had to provide all my paperwork such my diploma, ID, passport and the recruiting agency had set the interview dates.
Interview Questions: Questions related to my previous work experience, future plans...

title: ICT Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, and was invited to the interview. Interview took about an hour. There were four people on the interview. HR, Deputy Chief, and two technical directors from remote office on the Skype. After general questions, and introductions those technical directors asked technical questions.
Interview Questions: I didn't know that there will be people on the skype, and the quality of the connection wasn't good. So there questions that I didn't understand properly, and had to ask again and again.

title: Any Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Unicef is part of the UN system.  The hiring process at Unicef is quite thorough and time consuming.   From when you apply to actually being interviewed may take several months.  Expect multiple interviews in the process; team members, the hiring manager as well as HR.  You may be asked to submit samples of work or take a written test to measure your skillset; this often occurs in the areas of information management.   It is a very rigorous process designed to find the best fit and to ensure all candidates are treated fairly.    All interviews are competency based; be prepared to support verbally concrete measurable examples of key competencies such as strategic thinking, examples of teamwork, organizational skills, problem solving and more.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a failure in a process that you were responsible for.

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a job that was advertised online, was contacted for an interview by e-mail two months after I submitted the application, had a competency-based phone interview with a 3 member panel
Interview Questions: The broad subject of the questions (how one would react to different scenarios of collaboration and conflict) was not difficult. However, the specificity of some of the scenarios that the panel members described was a little challenging

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview over the phone. It was very friendly and focused mostly on general questions about my past, relevant experiences, plus some technical questions on public finance.
Interview Questions: They asked something technical almost only because I mentioned it in my conversation so be prepared to give further insights of what you mentioned in your resume, cover letter or your speaking points.

title: Programmer Analyst Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. The process took 6+ months. I interviewed at United Nations (New York, NY)
applied online then received an email to schedule a Phone interview. The phone interview was about 20 min. I was asked about my cv, and past experiences and what I would be able to add to the department I applied for.
Interview Questions: What are 3 things your former employees would say about you?

title: Agenda 2030for Sustainable Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via the UNICEF website. Got an email inquiring about interview timings about 2 months after. Had a phone interview, the consultant was very nice and welcoming. Asked me general knowledge questions about the Agenda 2030, my understanding of the UN charter, UNICEF principles and so on.
Interview Questions: Most UN interns are masters students, why should we take you even though you haven't even finished your undergrad?

title: Social Policy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process took more than 7 months.  Applied in January,  then went through written tests and various interviews over the phone around March and April,  then got job offer around June.
Interview Questions: Competency type of questions asking how one would behave in a given situation or how one dealt with a given situation and what were the results

title: Wash Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Applied online--> go for written test 3 after --> Interview with a panel of 3 people (1 human resource and 2 operation field officer)
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are qualified for the post?

title: Supporter Relation Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Generally friendly and pleasant. Questions are reasonable at the time. Feeling ease and relaxed. Friendly environment and nice office. Interviewed at the time that there were new campaigns were going on. Enjoyed the people there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Unicef?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview only, to be fair to candidates who are applying from abroad. However, frequently positions advertised already have an internal candidate intended for it.
Interview Questions: Very straightforward interview questions. Answering questions about past experience based on SWOT analysis will serve any interviewee well.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview. One panel interview.
Interview Questions: Strategic approach to learning and development

title: Individual Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Dhaka) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: interview was done in presence of human resources staff and WASH manager and based on my CV they asked me some questions relevant to my past experience and skill on WASH field. I tried my best to answer all the questions.
Interview Questions: please introduce yourself

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Had an internal contact and was hired after a resume review
Interview Questions: Specific questions on location were asked

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews via phone before I was hired. It was really really simple. Even though we were in the same city they interviewed me via phone. The first day that I saw them was my first day of work. Strange.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your resume

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Belgrade, Central Serbia) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Only one interview. It was nice and everyone was friendly. They mostly were interested in knowing about my background and why I was interested in studying what I was studying.
Interview Questions: How do you see your career trajectory?

title: Wedsite Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: A group of three interviewed for around 20 mins.  Interviewers were dress casually and even chit-chatted during our interview. The lead interviewer first asked my status and explained UNICEF policies for non-US citizens contractor before the actual interview started.  There were no hard questions.  All were job-related, your past experience, your experience on xxx filed,  your suggestions or recommendations for the website.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; your past experience, your experience on xxx filed,  your suggestions or recommendations for the website.

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application in the recruitment system + a cover letter. From the closing date within 6 weeks the shortlisted candidates (5) were sent a written test which was very technical and had to be responded to within 2 hours. It was marked anonymously. The top 3 candidates were then called for a phone interview by a panel of 4 people. It took over 2 months from the interview to get the results.
Interview Questions: UNICEF uses competency-based interviews - the panel had chosen some relevant competencies and the response had to demonstrate the specific competency from past experience.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds and it was a very difficult interview. They asked questions from academics and proffesional course done. It was not a stress type of interview and they made me quite comfortable and allowed me to relax. They kind of do some phychoanalysis also i guess.
Interview Questions: high salary or work satisfaction. Your priority

title: Programmer Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bucharest, Bucuresti) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The bureaucratic steps are strictly followed and everything seem perfectly organized. There is a competency based interview but the members of the interview panel do not necessarily have competences to carry out such interview.
Interview Questions: Competency based interview implies normally to provide several/different examples. It may occur that the questions from the panel insist that you answer based on a single example. You may end in not knowing what to add to answer properly.

title: Market Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (Dubai) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: the process started with a knowledge test. it was a multiple choice questions using a computer and powerpoint test to create a presentation and followed by a competency based interview with future line manager, HR personnel and an independent unicef employee.
Interview Questions: what do you know about UNICEF

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Not transparent process. They offered me the short term consultancy assignment after shortlisting my CV followed by an interview. I sent my agreement to the conditions mentioned in the mail and sent all required detail. After a couple of days they informed that the position is cancelled.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submit application including cover letter through the job portal. One phone interview that lasts about 30 minutes, with mainly generic and behavioural questions, though more technical questions may be asked depending on the role. An employee recommendation is very useful!
Interview Questions: How do you work under tight deadlines?

title: Wash Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNICEF in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: You need to apply online. Contacted for a written test 5 months after. and a panel interview with 3 people (human resource and 2 operation staff in the field) over the phone few weeks after the test.
Interview Questions: Competency Based Interview ONLY

title: Online Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Voorburg) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Een fysiek sollicitatiegesprek gehad met mijn stage begeleidster. Informeel maar tegelijkertijd professioneel. De vragen gingen voornamelijk over mijn achtergrond, mijn motivatie en wat ik verwachte van de functie en wat zij verwachten. Op basis daarvan aangenomen. Werd op mijn gemak gesteld. Positieve ervaring.
Interview Questions: Waarom UNICEF? Waarom deze functie?

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bengaluru) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called to attend a workshop where i had to help them out and then they asked me whether i would like this type of job. and i said yes. so they called me to join my work on 01st of May 2012 at M. S. Building, Bangalore. They said they would look after my stay and would case for the pick up from the stop i get down. For the salary first they said they would give 8000 and then they said they would give Rs. 10,000 per month including CTC.
Interview Questions: Would you like to work in Bangalore?

title: Data Base Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNICEF (Zagreb) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. At first I was greeted by three employees (I later learned that one of them will be my supervisor, the other two are also in high positions in the office). I should say something about myself, I said  which schools have I finished. They asked me how I handle knowledge in Excell. They asked me some specific questions from Excel and they asked me if I would be able (for a long time) to do this job, because it's quite exhausting and uniform. At the second interview, I had a conversation with someone who is right next to the boss's office. She told me what is my intended salary, warned me that my contributions will not be paid, as well as transportation. They were all very polite, and I can not at any time feel uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Programmer Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was for one hour exact. It consisted on general set of questions that are included in the employment package of the organisation and everybody (who is already within the system) can access it and prepare in advance. The panel followed these questions very strictly. they may ask some questions of clarification.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was very smooth I enjoyed the written test and discussions with the panel it was very nice discussing my profile with them
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (Lilongwe) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: the post was advertised in the local paper for three weeks, shortlisting was done and I attended two interviews.  The panel had five people all had different portifolio, among them was the head of the department
Interview Questions: written and oral

title: Operations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Since the post was advertised internally, we were well notified in advanced through internal memos and to other UN agencies also as per the Un norms.
The interview panel was very well constituted , representing HR, Staff Union, subject expert, the reporting officer to who the candidate will be reporting on selection for the post.
Enough time is given to the candidate, and the team ensures that the candidate is relaxed and comfortable right from the time of entry into the interview hall.
Interview Questions:
Questions are very relevant to the post . So if a candidate has really applied himself to any situation , should be able to answer the questions. 
Some technical questions , when unable to answer, one should be honest to declare his/her inability to answer.
Generally there are are technical questions on the subject and also one or two competency based questions. 
The competencies are already given in the job advertisement and one need to appraise himself/herself of the competencies in advance.

title: State Consultant Nutrition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Jaipur, Rajasthan) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Be fully prepared for the interview
Interview Questions: How will you improve the status of Malnutrition in State?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNICEF (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: First stage of the interview was a phone call. Pretty much typical questions. Second step was 1:1 Interview, again pretty standard stuff ( teamwork, how you handle stress and pressure although the environment is far from stressfull, position related questions etc.). One of the managers interviewing me was rather uncomfortable, Im guessing candidate screening wasnt her strong suit.
Interview Questions: According to me, questions were really easy.

title: Operations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview was nice and cordial. They tested me online first and then the results came and i was selected for the secodn round of interview whereby i was asked for a telecon interview. I passed that test too. Then i was called for a personal interview which i passed too. and then they said we will have a final round of interview which had 10 people in the panel.
Interview Questions: Difficluties in past job

title: IT Specialisat Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New York, NY) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Getting a permanent job with any UN agency is very time consuming since they receive so many applications and the process has to be very well documented and transparent from the organisation's perspective.  Typically, there is a phone interview for shortlisted candidates.  This typically takes 1 hour. Then if selected a face to face interview with a panel and / or individuals is requested.  During this phase some written tests may be given.
Interview Questions: N/A
